meanings.definition: To remove errors or defects from (a computer program)
meanings.sent1: I need to debug my code to fix the problem.
meanings.sent2: Programmers often debug their software before releasing it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer go to therapy? To debug its issues!
meanings.sent4: Debugging code is like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: She used her debugging skills to save the project from crashing.

meanings.definition: To identify and remove errors from (a system or process)
meanings.sent1: The IT team will debug the network to improve performance.
meanings.sent2: Engineers debugged the manufacturing process to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: Why did the robot break up with the computer? It couldn't handle the debugging!
meanings.sent4: Debugging a complex system is like untangling a knot.
meanings.sent5: He debugged the problem swiftly to prevent any further issues.
